title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON (AP) — In the hallowed halls of the Boston Garden, legends are born. On this night, it was Patrick Ewing who authored a chapter for the ages, delivering a performance of sheer, unadulterated dominance that lifted the New York Knicks to a bruising 113-102 victory over their archrivals.

From the opening tip, this was the Ewing show. The Knicks' center was an unstoppable force, a monolith in the painted area against which the Celtics had no answer. He poured in a staggering 44 points, a testament to his vast arsenal of low-post moves and automatic mid-range jumpers. Each basket was a hammer blow, silencing the raucous Boston crowd and systematically dismantling the Celtic defense.

Ewing was not merely a scorer; he was a titan. He corralled 21 rebounds, a Herculean effort that denied Boston second chances and fueled New York’s transition game. His presence was so overwhelming that it opened the floor for others, though on this night, he was the singular, undeniable engine of victory. Every entry pass became must-see theater, every shot a near-certainty.

While the Celtics fought valiantly, with Dana Barros providing a spark off the bench, they simply had no counter for Ewing’s historic outing. This was a legendary performance in one of basketball’s most storied rivalries. Ewing didn’t just win a game; he stamped his authority on it, carrying his team on his broad shoulders with a 44-point, 21-rebound masterpiece that will be remembered whenever these two giants clash.
